_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:43 using v2.7
title: How have the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services changed?
analysis_commentary:
Similar to the number of nurses in community services the numbers of nurses in psychiatric services also do not follow the same overall pattern for all qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff.

There has been a steady decline in the number of non-community psychiatric nurses (other psychiatry) between September 2009 and May 2015, from 26,299 to 21,801; this represents a 17% decrease. The number of community psychiatric nurses has remained steady.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
